column8: 相位通讯：库姆·失去言语

<Title:简介>
弗朗西斯饲喂的「宠物」。
本是名为「丽莎」的活泼少女，经雕塑家协会的改造转变为人兽缝合的扭曲形态，后被莉莉收养，暂时生活在疯人院内。
尽管丧失了人类的外貌和发声能力，库姆仍保留着丽莎的部分心智，能够通过简单的肢体动作传达自己的意图。
她做出了自己的选择。
column9:
Francis's "pet."
Originally a lively Maiden named "Lisa," she was transformed by the Sculptors' Association into a Distorted human-animal hybrid, and later adopted by Lily, temporarily living within the asylum.
Despite losing her human appearance and ability to speak, Koum retains part of Lisa's mind, capable of conveying her intention through simple physical gestures.
She has made her own choice.

column8:
可爱的房间，精美的家具，绒绒的毯子，华丽的裙摆，端庄的礼仪。淑女墨菲被慷慨地赐予他人望尘莫及的地位和垂涎以求的珍宝，却始终生活如行尸走肉。

某个无人知晓的夜里，她悄悄躲在废弃的衣柜中，被蹈海者的鱼人们摇摇晃晃地抬出教会，弃置在一片荒无人烟的郊野中。

她推开衣柜，旷野星光灿烂。
她跃过杂物的小山，在山脚拾到一枚小球。

当戈利亚带着惊惶的鱼人小队找到遗失的圣女时，她仍坐在距离衣柜不远的地方，将手中的小球高高抛起，等小球滚落，再一次高高抛起——
戈利亚半句话也没有询问，就将圣女重新押回了名为供奉的牢笼。
所以她所作所为的目的，始终不曾言说，直至将匕首刺入胸膛的时刻，也一直埋藏在心底。

——她想将球抛上又大又圆的月亮。
——那样的话，它就不必再落下了。
column9:
A lovely room. Exquisite furniture. Plush rugs. Flowing skirts. Perfect manners. Lady Murphy was generously granted a status others could only dream of, along with treasures they would kill to possess. Yet she lived as though hollowed out, drifting through life like a soulless husk.

One night, unseen by any, she hid inside an abandoned wardrobe.
The fishmen of the Seafarers cult carried it, swaying and creaking, out of the church and left it in the middle of a desolate field.

She pushed open the wardrobe. Above her, the starlit wilderness glittered.
She skipped over a hill of discarded junk, and at its foot, found a small ball.

When Goliath finally arrived with his panicked squad of fishmen to retrieve the missing Holy Maiden, they found her not far from the wardrobe, seated in the grass.
She tossed the ball high into the air, watched it fall, and tossed it again, higher still.
Goliath didn't ask a single question. He simply brought her back—back to the prison they called a shrine.
And so her reasons were never spoken, until the day she drove that dagger into her chest. They remained buried in silence.

—That night, she had wanted to throw her ball to the moon. That great, round moon.
—So high up in the sky, so it wouldn't have to fall back down again.

column8: 主祭记不清这是他第几次主持试炼了，那些有着澄澈眼神的孩子在鱼人仪式上呈现出各异的神情，有些兴奋、有些犹豫、有些苦恼、有些麻木，但弥利亚姆是不一样的。弥利亚姆的痛苦，凌驾于那些承受仪式的鱼人之上。
column9: The High Priest lost count of how many trials he had presided over. The children displayed a range of emotions during the Fishman Ritual—excitement, hesitation, distress, numbness—but Miryam was different. Her pain surpassed that of the Fishmen undergoing the ritual.

column8: 弥利亚姆跪在祷告室中央。她的鱼人父亲的嘴一张一合。她勉力去记住他膨胀的眼球，鳃腺的弧度，鳞片的层次……为了重逢之日。
column9: Miryam kneels in the center of the prayer room. Her fishman father's mouth opens and closes. She struggles to remember the details of his bulging eyes, the curves of his gill arches, and the stacks of his scales... for the day of their reunion.
